content.description: Stand start with a pair of sloping edges and thin feet. From there, climb straight up through a hueco to an edge, then reach the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: Two to three pads. The landing is slightly uneven due to a pair of rocks.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's north face.

content.description:
Chigger Big climbs traverses a crimp seam on great rock over a poor landing.

Sit start with a left hand on a small, positive rail, a right hand crimp, and a left heel on an edge. From there, pull up, reach a left hand edge, follow with the right to an edge, bump to a slightly better edge, bump the left hand up to a sidepull, stick a good edge further along the seam with the right hand, find a left heel in the overhang, then gain the large shelf at the corner, follow with the feet, rock onto the slab, reach a right hand gaston, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads, minimum. There is a large rock at the center of the problem.
content.location: It climbs the northwest section of Prism Stone.
